editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: DUNS SCOTUS, JOHN SACKVILLE, SIMON OF FAVERSHAM &c.; S. XIV in.

physDesc.p: Seven originally independent books or booklets, bound together during s. xiv.

supportDesc.extent:
385 leaves (iv + 382, omitting 116) 295 225
The edges drastically retrimmed, affecting marginalia. Foliation of s. xiv, 1–401, omitting 38, 190–9, 333 in error; 58, 127, 236 twice, an unnumbered leaf before 109 (now 107), and showing that the original 96–7, 377–88 are missing. fols. 1 and 10 are misbound, upside down and in reverse order.
supportDesc.collation: 110, 26, 3–412, 512(lacks 11), 612, 76 / 8–912, 104, 11–1212, 1310, 146 / 1512, 168(8 canc.) / 17–1812, 194 / 20–2212, 2310 / 24–3312, 3410, 354(lacks 3–4), 364 / 3712(+ 1 after 12). Catchwords and occasional leaf-numbers. Misbinding and losses occurred both before and after the medieval foliation.

binding.p: Maltby undated (post-Powicke), replacing one of s. xvii. fols. i-ii and 381–2 are modern blank paper binding leaves. fols. iii-iv are paper leaves from the former binding, the first the title page from the printed book as in MS 19.

history.provenance: At the head of f. 279v is a smudged pen trial of s. xiv, ‘Caucio domini Willelmi de d[... e ... d ... ]’.
On f. 401, s. xiv ‘1 liber de Philosophia’, s. xiv-xv ‘Liber aule de Merton’ in Oxonia’.
On the last leaves are the marks of the large iron chain-staple.
Seen at Merton by John Bale (Appendix C, nos 26, 52), whose incipit shows that art. 2 still had its beginning. ‘8’ is inked on the foredge.
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with table of contents, s. xvii, ‘E. 7, 5’, canc., and ‘Q. 2. 8. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘O. 1. 6 (CCXCII)’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, pp. 115–16; F. Pelster in Philosophisches Jahrbuch (1930), 478–82; Powicke, no. 518; O. Lewry in Mediaeval Studies 44 (1982), 138–80, at 146–51, 159–67, 175–80 (edn. of art. 15).

msItem.author: JOHN DUNS SCOTUS
msItem.title: Quaestiones on ARISTOTLE, Metaphysics
msItem.incipit: Omnes homines nature scire desiderant. In principio metaphisice quam pre manibus habemus premittit philosophus
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt ista que tu Iohannes sophista.
msItem.note: Headed ‘Questiones metaphysicorum [doctoris subtilis]’, ‘Otleye’ over the erasure. Perhaps Simon de Otteley (BRUO 1410), fellow of Oriel College in 1347 and 1349.
DSO (Gál), 3(1–2), this copy (collated as A) at I, pp. vii-viii; the editors note that substantial parts of IX qq. 14 and 15 have been omitted. Lohr, pp. 192–3; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 240.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with multiple red lines, written in c. 60 lines, in 2 cols from f. 35v.

handDesc.handNote: The main text is written in anglicana (two scribes, changing at fols. 63v/64).

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics.

msItem.author: JOHN SACKVILLE
msItem.title: De Principiis Naturae
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf.) habens et etiam quia speculacio intellectus discernit
msItem.finalRubric: Compilaciones intitulate Mihi cordi collecte per magistrum I. de Sicca Villa de principiis nature: prima pars que est de principiis nature in primo gradu scilicet materia forma et priuacione explicit.
msItem.note: On the author, who died c. 1295, see BRUO 1661–2. The work is also in BL Roy. 12 E. xxv (also from Merton Coll.), fols. 32–60.
Ed. R.-M. Giguère (Univ. of Montréal, Publs. de l’inst. d’études méd., Montreal/Paris, 1956); Sharpe, Handlist, p. 319.

msItem.author: ?JOHN SACKVILLE
msItem.title: De Excellentia Philosophiae
msItem.incipit: Cum in omni natura per se subsistere sint tria, substantia, uirtus et operacio
msItem.explicit: in logica ut ibidem dicit auctor
msItem.note: The unique copy; unpr.; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 319.

msItem.author: ROBERT KILWARDBY
msItem.title: De Natura Relationis
msItem.incipit: De predicato relationis querunt aliqui
msItem.explicit: subicitur priori expositiori in dictis suis.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt commoditates super relacionem tradite a magistro Iohanne de Seccheuille.
msItem.note: Ed. L. Schmücker (Lenggries, 1980); Glorieux, Arts 411x; Kaeppeli 3515; Sharpe, Handlist, pp. 319, 562.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 56 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Low-grade gothic rotunda book-hand, showing anglicana features. Parts II and VI appear to be in the same hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics.

msItem.author: SIMON OF FAVERSHAM
msItem.title: Commentaries on ARISTOTLE, Logica Vetus
Praed.
msItem.incipit: Vtrum numerus sit quantitas. (Beg. impf. in q. 36) ex istis duobus tanquam ex mentali et formali constituitur
msItem.explicit: de ea qualitas est in quantitatibus

msItem.title: Periher.
msItem.incipit: Primum oportet dicere &c. Nota quod passiones anime tripliciter accipiuntur

msItem.title: Elench.
msItem.incipit: Sicut dicit philosophus secundo de anima potentie distinguntur per actus

msItem.title: Prior.
msItem.incipit: Tria sunt genera causarum in entibus
msItem.explicit: eterna in Deo quia saltim ydealis ideo &c.;

msItem.title: Post.
msItem.incipit: Sicut dicit philosophus x. ethicorum talis uita que uacat contemplationi ueritatis

msItem.note: Lohr, pp. 141–3; Sharpe, Handlist, pp. 612–13. 1 and 2 ed. P. Mazzarella, Magistri Simonis Anglici sive de Faverisham Opera Omnia 1 Opera Logica (Padua, 1957), pp. 71–143, 151–70 (from Milan, Bibl. Ambros., C. 161 inf.); 3 ed. S. Ebbesen et al. (Toronto, 1984); passages from 4 ed. S. Ebbeson in CIMA 53 (1986), 139–49 and 55 (1987), 158–60; 5 unpr.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 65 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Low-grade gothic rotunda book-hands, showing anglicana features.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics. On f. 136 is a circular diagram in ink of text.

msItem.author: ROBERT GROSSETESTE
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, Posterior Analytics
msItem.incipit: Omnis doctrina &c. Intencio Aristotelis in hoc libro est inuestigare et manifestare essentialia demonstrationis
msItem.note: The rest of f. 185v is filled with text in an anglicana hand.
Ed. P. Rossi (Florence, 1981); Thomson, Grosseteste, p. 84; Lohr, pp. 103–4.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 56 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Low-grade gothic rotunda book-hands, showing anglicana features.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics.

msItem.author: SIMON OF FAVERSHAM
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, Physics
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf. in Phys. II. 1) est .ii. in generali et in corporali secundum solutionem suam
msItem.explicit: concordant omnes leges secundum quod dicit commentator.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt questiones disputate a magistro Simone de Fauersham super libro phisicorum reportate a Roberto de Clothale.
msItem.note: The same explicit to the text is in Erfurt, Wissenschaftliche Bibl. der Stadt, Amplon. F. 348, f. 69.
Clothale (BRUO446), chancellor of St Paul’s, London, fl. 1290–1319.

Unpr.; see F. M. Powicke, ‘Master Simon of Faversham’, in Mélanges d’histoire du moyen âge offerts à M. Ferdinand Lot (Paris, 1925), pp. 650–8, D. A. Callus, ‘The introduction of Aristotelian learning to Oxford’, Proc. of the British Academy 29 (1943), 277–8; Lohr, pp. 143–4; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 613.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with pencil in 2 cols; written in 55–62 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Low-grade gothic rotunda book-hands, showing anglicana features.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics.

msItem.author: PETRUS DE ALVERNIA
msItem.title: Quaestiones on ARISTOTLE, Metaphysics
msItem.incipit: Omnes homines natura scire &c. Sicut dicit philosophus in xmo sue Metaphysice In omni genere est aliquod quod est principium
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in bk. IX q. ‘Vtrum sit una potentia secundum rationem duorum contrariorum’) differens tamen secundum rationem. substantia
msItem.note: Unpr.; Lohr, pp. 336–7 (listing published lists of quaestiones and excerpts).

msItem.author: ALBERTUS MAGNUS
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, De Somno et Vigilia
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber primus de sompno et uigilia ...
msItem.incipit: Sompnus et uigilia non sunt passiones
msItem.explicit: a principio quere de hac materia.
msItem.note: AMO(Borgnet) 9. 121–207; Fauser 23.

msItem.author: ALBERTUS MAGNUS
msItem.title: De Spiritu et Respiratione
msItem.incipit: Multa sunt animalia que quidem secundum locum non moueantur
msItem.note: AMO(Borgnet) 9. 213–51; Fauser 24.

msItem.author: ALBERTUS MAGNUS
msItem.title: De Intellectu et Intelligibili bk. 1
msItem.incipit: Sicut a principio istius operis diximus scientia de anima non satis complete habetur
msItem.note: At the foot of f. 346 are two lines of polyphonic music, part of a Magnificat setting, s. xiv ex., 3-part on 5-line staves. incl. ‘tenor’ and ‘medius’.
AMO(Borgnet) 9. 477–502; Fauser 22.

msItem.author: SIGER OF BRABANT
msItem.title: Quaestiones on ARISTOTLE, De Anima III
msItem.incipit: De parte autem anime quam cognoscit et sapit. Et circa istum 3um librum contingit querere de intellectu quatuor
msItem.note: Ed. B. Bazan, Siger de Brabant: Quaestiones in tertium De Anima (Louvain/Paris, 1972), pp. 1–69; Lohr, p. 133, this copy only.

msItem.author: SIMON OF FAVERSHAM
msItem.title: Quaestiones on ARISTOTLE, De Anima III
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt questiones super tertium de anima disputate a magistro Symone de Fauisham, et precedentes sunt magistri Sigeri super eodem tertio.
msItem.incipit: Queritur de intellectu nostro utrum sit de nouo factus an sit ab eterno
msItem.note: Ed. D. Sharp, AHDLMA 9 (1934), 307–68, who omits the last word and does not indicate that the text breaks off at the end of the quire; Lohr, pp. 144–5; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 613.

msItem.title: Quaestiones and sophisms
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf.) causam necessaria est habitudo
msItem.explicit: (363) immo hoc est ens absolutum illud uocabulo dependens. Ista sufficiant ad presens.
msItem.incipit: Sophisma. Sortes est hoc aliquid. Probatur sic. Omnis substantia pura est hoc aliquid Sortes est substantia
Omnis substantia materialis est substantia quanta &c. Probatio et improbatio patet et solusio. Circa istud sophisma tria querebantur
(365v) Accidens circa ens proponitur sciendi siue predicatur de diuidentibus
msItem.note: In the lower margin of f. 362 a hand of c. 1500 writes ‘Vtrum ens sit uniuocum sed deest primaquestionis pars’.

msItem.title: Two graduation speeches
msItem.incipit: Tullius 3º rethorice sue Omnis inquit humana laus ex tribus generibus bonorum enascitur
msItem.explicit: Tenor similiter commendare dominus N. socium suum sed nulla instat necessitas ...
msItem.note: On f. 367rv is an added list of ‘Conclusiones libri Ethicorum’, as in Balliol Coll., MS 108, art. 3, but shorter, ending with bk. 4 quaest. 40, cropped. Lohr, p. 146 (as by Simon of Faversham).

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 56 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Low-grade gothic rotunda book-hands, showing anglicana features. Parts II and VI appear to be by the same hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics. Some rubrication, red paraphs and touching.

msItem.author: SIMON OF FAVERSHAM
msItem.title: Quaestiones on ARISTOTLE, Parua Naturalia
Quaestiones on Aristotle's De somno et vigilia
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf.) Vnde odor propter animali mentalem condicionem
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt questiones de sompno et uigilia reportate per dominum Symonem de F.

msItem.title: Quaestiones super librum De motu animalium
msItem.incipit: De motu eo qui animalium est &c. Sicut dicit philosophus in 10. physicorum motus reperitur tamen in tribus generibus
msItem.explicit: sit ille quod predicatur a partibus similibus

msItem.title: Quaestiones on Aristotle's De longitudine et brevitate vitae
msItem.incipit: (f. 375) De eo quod est longe uite animalium. Communis queritur utrum de causa longitudinis et breuitatis uite possit esse sciencia

msItem.title: Quaestiones on Aristotle's De iuventute et senectute
msItem.incipit: (f. 378) De iuuentute et senectute et cetera. Quia philosophus dicit hic in principio quod natura et substantia anime est in particula determinata corporis

msItem.title: Quaestiones on De inspiratione et respiratione
msItem.incipit: (f. 379) Consequenter queritur circa partem illam Animalium autem quam hec quidem aquatilia et cetera. Vbi philosophus incipit determinare de respiracione et ibi queratur utrum respiratio sit necessarium alicui generi animalium
msItem.explicit: non est purus sicut nec ad elementum.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt questiones de iuuentute et senectute de inspiratione et respiracione disputate a domino Symone de Fauersham.

msItem.note: Unpr.; Lohr, p. 145, this and one other fragmentary copy; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 613.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 58 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Low-grade gothic rotunda book-hands, showing anglicana features.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics.
